body_html:
@asimshankar sorry, what was the comment I haven't answered, things have intermixed so much...

As of unit test, those tests you've mentioned check that graphs loaded from protobuf string do contain variables described in protobuf, I would rather call it protobuf unit tests.
But my patch does not really change on-disk protobuf layout, it is runtime feature that I allow to set.

Is there a way to kind of run simple graph and check that it has been executed on the requested device?

As of unit test, those tests you've mentioned check that graphs loaded from protobuf string do contain variables described in protobuf, I would rather call it protobuf unit tests.
But my patch does not really change on-disk protobuf layout, it is runtime feature that I allow to set.
Is there a way to kind of run simple graph and check that it has been executed on the requested device?
body:
@asimshankar sorry, what was the comment I haven't answered, things have intermixed so much...

As of unit test, those tests you've mentioned check that graphs loaded from protobuf string do contain variables described in protobuf, I would rather call it protobuf unit tests.
But my patch does not really change on-disk protobuf layout, it is runtime feature that I allow to set.

Is there a way to kind of *run* simple graph and check that it has been executed on the requested device?
